thread.title: National reaction: Ex-Longhorns lobby for Mack Brown to replace Steve Patterson as Texas AD
thread.title_full: National reaction: Ex-Longhorns lobby for Mack Brown to replace Steve Patterson as Texas AD | Dallas Morning News

author: Nick Castillo
title: National reaction: Ex-Longhorns lobby for Mack Brown to replace Steve Patterson as Texas AD
text:
Texas Athletic Director Steve Patterson has been fired, sources told Dallas Morning News reporter Chuck Carlton.
After the news broke Tuesday, current and former Longhorn players and the national media reacted on Twitter.
Here are some reactions about Tuesday's news seen on Twitter:
Junior defensive end Bryce Cottrell:
2 Presidents, 2 ADs, 2 Head coaches, 4 OCs 3 Position coaches 3 DCs Talk about a wild 4 years...
— Bryce Cottrell (@brycecottrell27) September 15, 2015 Senior wide receiver Marcus Johnson:
Pretty sure my class has been through some of the most change within a 3 year period of any sports program.
— Marcus Johnson (@MisterJohnson06) September 15, 2015 Former safety Kenny Vaccaro:
@ESPN_CoachMack for AD
— Kenny Dwayne Vaccaro (@KennyVaccaro4) September 15, 2015 Former offensive guard Kasey Studdard:
I agree with @KennyVaccaro4 , @ESPN_CoachMack for new AD. Please let this happen
— kasey studdard (@Studdard64) September 15, 2015 Former linebacker Emmanuel Acho:
So #Texas will pay the athletic director 5.6 million to fire him, but the athletes can't get paid?? #TwitterQuestions #MackBrownForAD
— Emmanuel Acho (@thEMANacho) September 15, 2015 Stewart Mandel, Sports Illustrated:
As for this Mack Brown talk ... just stop. Charlie Strong is still trying to clean up that mess, now he'd be his boss??
— Stewart Mandel (@slmandel) September 15, 2015 Carson Cunningham, KOCO 5 â“ reply to Mandel:
Here's the new Texas AD, as @slmandel requested. pic.twitter.com/YOGLEaz9zB
— Carson Cunningham (@KOCOCarson) September 15, 2015 Brett McMurhpy, ESPN â“ reaction from former Texas coach Mack Brown:
Mack Brown: âœI hate this for Steve, he was good to me. Iâ™m really happy at ESPN/ABC. I have had no discussions w/anyone about the AD job"
— Brett McMurphy (@McMurphyESPN) September 15, 2015 Bruce Feldman, Fox Sports:
#Texas could've had Oliver Luck, one of the brightest & most respected ppl in athletics. instead it went w Patterson https://t.co/vK6RTGnFOp
— Bruce Feldman (@BruceFeldmanCFB) September 15, 2015 Pat Forde, Yahoo Sports:
Now that Texas has corrected one error by firing Steve Patterson, maybe it can correct another by re-hiring John Bianco. UT needs him back.
— Pat Forde (@YahooForde) September 15, 2015 Ian Fitzsimmons, ESPN Radio:
Steve Patterson was a square peg trying to fit in a round hole at Texas. He hacked off big money backers - this isn't a surprise.
— Ian Fitzsimmons (@Ianfitzespn) September 15, 2015 Kirk Herbstreit, ESPN:
Now that Texas got rid of their AD can somebody do the right thing & bring back the best SID in CFB John Bianco?!? Why was he let go again?
— Kirk Herbstreit (@KirkHerbstreit) September 15, 2015 More on split of Texas, Steve Patterson
(Eric Gay/AP)
Carlton: Steve Patterson provided blueprint of what not to do as Texas athletic director
Texas AD Steve Patterson out after two years with Longhorns
Sherrington: With AD out, no sure things at Texas for Charlie Strong, others
Possible Texas AD candidates include Mack Brown and Big 12 competitors
